From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure process-level timer validation on a scheduler, and check the timer tree of the process after every context switch of the process Packet Identification number (PID) is configured, use the **scheduler timercheck process** command in global configuration mode. To disable this configuration, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: PID number in the range is from 1 to 2147483647.

Examples: The following example shows how to configure process-level timer validation on a scheduler with a PID value of 5:
1 On every context switch. Chunk Manager
ExtraInfo: Specify the **show processes timercheck** command after configuring the **schedule timercheck process** command to display the details of the configuration.

RelatedCmds.description: Displays information about the active Cisco IOS processes or the Cisco IOS Software Modularity POSIX-style processes.
Configures system-level validation on context switches on a scheduler.
